name: Custom Viewer Count Widget
author: Chirag Joshi

sections.description:
With this plugin, you can easily keep track of how many times your products are being viewed on your website.
The widget displays the viewer count and includes an eye or fire icon based on the number of views.
If the viewer count is greater than 50, a fire icon is displayed. If it’s less than 50, an eye icon with a pulse animation is displayed.

The widget is easy to install and customize. Simply activate the plugin and it will automatically be displayed on your Woocommerce product pages.
You can modify the appearance of the widget by modifying the CSS in the plugin’s stylesheet.
sections.installation:
Upload the plugin files to the /wp-content/plugins/custom-viewer-count-widget directory, or install the plugin through the WordPress plugins screen directly.
Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ screen in WordPress
The widget will automatically be displayed on your Woocommerce product pages.
sections.faq:
How do I customize the appearance of the widget?

You can customize the appearance of the widget by modifying the CSS in the plugin’s styles

Can I change the number at which the fire icon is displayed?

Yes, you can change the number at which the fire icon is displayed by modifying the code in the plugin’s functions.php file.

Is the Font Awesome library required for the plugin to work?

Yes, the Font Awesome library is required for the plugin to display the eye and fire icons. The library is automatically included in the plugin.
